content:
GeneralTransform Class

Definition

Provides generalized transformation support for objects, such as points and rectangles. This is an abstract class.

In this Article

[System.Windows.Localizability(System.Windows.LocalizationCategory.None, Readability=System.Windows.Readability.Unreadable)]
public abstract class GeneralTransform : System.Windows.Media.Animation.Animatable, IFormattable

Remarks

A transform defines how to map points from one coordinate space into another coordinate space. They can be used to produce effects such as rotation, scaling, and skewing.

Constructors

GeneralTransform()

Initializes a new instance of the GeneralTransform class.

protected GeneralTransform ();
Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute

Properties

Inverse

Gets the inverse transformation of this GeneralTransform, if possible.

public abstract System.Windows.Media.GeneralTransform Inverse { get; }
Value
GeneralTransform

An inverse of this instance, if possible; otherwise null.

Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute

Methods

Clone()

Creates a modifiable clone of this GeneralTransform, making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

public System.Windows.Media.GeneralTransform Clone ();
Returns
GeneralTransform

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

For more information, see Clone.

CloneCurrentValue()

Creates a modifiable clone of this GeneralTransform object, making deep copies of this object's current values. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.

public System.Windows.Media.GeneralTransform CloneCurrentValue ();
Returns
GeneralTransform

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

For more information, see CloneCurrentValue.

Transform(Point)

Transforms the specified point and returns the result.

public System.Windows.Point Transform (System.Windows.Point point);
Parameters
point
Point

The point to transform.

Returns
Point

The result of transforming point.

Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute
Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The transform did not succeed.

TransformBounds(Rect)

When overridden in a derived class, transforms the specified bounding box and returns an axis-aligned bounding box that is exactly large enough to contain it.

public abstract System.Windows.Rect TransformBounds (System.Windows.Rect rect);
Parameters
rect
Rect

The bounding box to transform.

Returns
Rect

The smallest axis-aligned bounding box possible that contains the transformed rect.

Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute

TryTransform(Point, Point)

When overridden in a derived class, attempts to transform the specified point and returns a value that indicates whether the transformation was successful.

public abstract bool TryTransform (System.Windows.Point inPoint, out System.Windows.Point result);
Parameters
inPoint
Point

The point to transform.

result
Point

The result of transforming inPoint.

Returns
Boolean

true if inPoint was transformed; otherwise, false.

Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute

Remarks

Unlike the Transform method, this method does not throw an exception if the transformation is unsuccessful.

Explicit Interface Implementations

IFormattable.ToString(String, IFormatProvider)

Formats the value of the current instance using the specified format.

string IFormattable.ToString (string format, IFormatProvider provider);
Parameters
format
String

The format to use.

-or-

A null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) to use the default format defined for the type of the IFormattable implementation.

provider
IFormatProvider

The provider to use to format the value.

-or-

A null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) to obtain the numeric format information from the current locale setting of the operating system.

Returns
String

The value of the current instance in the specified format.
